column4: I am working on expanding two partitions and shrinking a third, I can't seem to expand my Windows partition, does anyone know why?
The linux one worked fine, but the windows one doesn't give me the option
Gparted!
Yeahhh
The unallocated space is at the beginning of /dev/sda3
the one i want to expand is /dev/sda2
ohh, hm, how do i check?
I'm running a live CD btw
Yes, sda3 does
and sda2?
strange you should be able to resize it
it means it is loked (mounted I think)
want me to upload a picture for you?
ok but not expect too much from me  :)
http://www.tiikoni.com/tis/view/?id=0b168f3
do you run gparted from live cd?
try to shrink sda3 because it is extended partition and your unallocated space is inside of it
shrink from left to right to get unallocated space outside of sda3
thanks for trying to help, my gf wants me to watch the movie with her, I'll be back later!
it is smart decision  8-)
